alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 4:56AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Oahu in Honolulu County. * WHEN...Until 745 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 AM HST, radar indicated moderate to heavy rain over windward Oahu, falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour, and water levels are rising in streams that drain from the Koolaus. Additional rain is approaching from the south, likely to also affect leeward and urban areas through the morning commute. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... the entire island of Oahu, especially windward areas. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 745 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect.
